title: 1000 Serious Moves
description: 2012-08-15 - 1000 Serious Moves - We easily habituate to feeling stressed, leaning forward, trying to figure things out and get things done.  The undercurrent is we are living reactively--resisting unpleasant experience, seeking out more comfort and ease-- perpetually wanting life to be different than it is.  In response to this confined way of living, the Buddha invites us to discover our innate capacity for happiness, the wellbeing that arises in full presence.  These two  talks explore the ways we get caught in the trance of reactivity and grimness, and the pathways to unconditioned  happiness.
